title: Economic Explainability Narrative Builder
reason: We need this skill because missions need explicit tradeoff logic for cost, speed, and impact. This specific skill translates technical decisions into operator-usable narratives.
implementationGuide: Define the scope and success metrics for `Economic Explainability Narrative Builder`, including at least three measurable KPIs tied to overspending and low-impact allocation.
Design and version the input/output contract for budgets, costs, benefits, and opportunity values, then add schema validation and failure-mode handling.
Implement the core capability using reason synthesis and abstraction, and produce decision narratives with deterministic scoring.
Integrate the skill into swarm orchestration: task routing, approval gates, retry strategy, and rollback controls.
Add unit, integration, and simulation tests that explicitly cover overspending and low-impact allocation, then run regression baselines.
Deploy behind a feature flag, monitor telemetry/alerts for two release cycles, and iterate thresholds based on observed outcomes.

validationGates.check: All required input signals present and schema-valid
Repeated run on same inputs yields stable scoring and artifacts
Approval gates satisfied before publish-level outputs

knownFailures.action: Reject payload, emit validation error, request corrected payload
Freeze output, escalate to human approval router
Apply retry policy then rollback to last stable baseline

produces: Economic Explainability Narrative Builder normalized artifacts
